page.title: 05Farming
page.content: Over the last 5 to 10 years traditional dairy farming has given way to all types of arable farming in this area. There are now crops like maize, oil seed rape, peas and beans as well as barley and wheat. Consequently, the fields have become larger; many hedges have been removed to make room for the combine harvester and other machinery. Some of the smaller farms have been swallowed up by the bigger ones, leaving an excess of farmhouses which have been made into private houses. Britain joining the EEC has made a great difference to farmers with policies and prices now decided in Brussels not London. Milk quotas, grain mountains and milk lakes affect them. Chew Valley farmers sell their livestock at the Avon Livestock Centre just outside the village.
